intro: Xanthoxalis corniculata, commonly known as the golden buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and palmate leaves that resemble those of a buttercup. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Xanthoxalis corniculata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation.
